item.title: Pokemon Go Fest Heads To Paris This Summer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-go-fest-heads-to-paris-this-summer/1100-6529961/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Pokemon Go is on the go again and traveling to the city of lights. Niantic, the developer of Pokemon Go, has announced that Pokemon Go Fest is heading to Paris, France and inviting trainers from all over the world to take part in the celebration.

Via the Pokemon Go official site, Pokemon Go Fest: Paris will take place in the city of Paris and the Parc de Sceaux from June 13-15. Early bird tickets are on sale today, March 6, before the tickets go up to full price on April 2. This event will feature the Pokemon Go debut of Volcanion, Every player with a ticket will receive access to special research about the creature and get a chance to encounter it.

Players on hand will also have the first opportunity to see the new forms of Crowned Sword Zacian and Crowned Shield Zamazenta during Five Star Raids. As in Pokemon Go Fest's previous stops, Niantic will provide a curated route that will let players take in some of Paris' landmarks while keeping an eye out for elusive Pokemon. The Parc de Sceaux will have real-life Pokemon habitats where players can meet Pokemon mascots and trainers, compete head-to-head in the PVP battle ground, and shop for exclusive merchandise.

"The charm of Paris, its walkability, and its globally recognized landmarks create the perfect playground for Pok√©mon GO Fest," said Pokemon Go Live Events Marketing Manager Lena Cillis in a statement. "We're eager to see Trainers explore this beautiful city and the elegant Parc de Sceaux alongside France's passionate community and visitors from around the world."

Before this event, Pokemon Go Fest will visit Osaka, Japan from May 29-June 1, and Jersey City, New Jersey from June 6-8. Following Pokemon Go Fest: Paris, Ninatic will hold a Pokemon Go Fest Global event from June 28-29.

If you're looking for something to do sooner, Niantic has already shared the Pokemon Go events for March. Outside of Pokemon Go, The Pokemon Company CEO Tsunekazu Ishihara recently suggested that the franchise could go downhill if the company ever loses its focus. So far, there are no signs of that happening. In fact, the next Pokemon Switch game, Pokemon Legends Z-A, recently unveiled a few of its starter Pokeman ahead of its launch late this year.

item.title: WWE 2K25 - How To Change Your Character's Appearance In The Island
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/wwe-2k25-how-to-change-your-characters-appearance-in-the-island/1100-6529962/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

In WWE 2K25's new Island mode, you'll explore an open-world PvPvE hub full of shops, events, and other players. But one thing you might lose track of is how to change your character's appearance in The Island. In our brief guide, we'll walk you through how to do just that, so your future WWE superstar can look just the way you want them to. Better yet, this same method we'll show you also lets you adjust their moveset to your liking.

How to customize your character's appearance and moves in WWE 2K25 The Island

There's only one way to change what your character looks like in The Island, since it's a mode split off from your library of create-a-wrestlers (CAWs) and your MyRise story mode superstar. When you create your Island character, the game might usher you right past the customization suite, leaving you to need to get back to it after some brief onboarding into the new mode.

Once you can freely explore the Island, you'll want to look for a pathway between the pink-colored barber shop and the Nike and Jordan stores. Down that way, you'll see an elaborate building decorated with Cody Rhodes' American Nightmare logo.

Head down that pathway and look to the left of Rhodes' hub. There, you'll see a kiosk called MyBooth--these 2K games love branding by removing the space between words. Interact with the circular kiosk to jump into a menu where you can change your wrestler's appearance or moves. There are other MyBooth stations around the Island, but this is the one closest to where you load into the world. Since the mode strangely lacks a map, we'll just say you can generally expect to find a MyBooth kiosk near a few of the distinct zones within the Island hub. There's another one by the Hall of Legends, for example, and another in the Temple of the Ancestors.

Everything currently available to your character will be there, and beyond the build options you chose at their creation--like their fighting style, height, and weight--nothing is untouchable, so you can continue to edit them as much as you'd like. As you see in the screenshots here, I tried making Larry David. If you see him around the Island, just leave him be. He hates a stop-and-chat.

For more on WWE 2K25, don't miss the full Showcase matches list, with all rewards and unlockables detailed. You can also find the full WWE 2K25 roster, including DLC characters yet to arrive.

item.title: Xbox Players Can Check Out These Games For Free This Weekend
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/xbox-players-can-check-out-these-games-for-free-this-weekend/1100-6529957/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Microsoft has announced a new edition of Free Play Days, offering free access to four games starting today, March 6 and ending on March 10.

The biggest game on the list is Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege. Ubisoft's popular shooter has entered its 10th year and Xbox Game Pass subscribers can check it out for free. It's especially good timing as the franchise is preparing for its biggest transformation yet with Siege X later this month. This game is also getting a bonus day, so it's available until Monday, March 10 at 11:59 AM PT / 2:59 PM ET.

AEW: Fight Forever and Test Drive Unlimited Crown are available until Sunday, March 9 at 11:59 PM PT / 2:59 AM ET. They also both require Xbox Game Pass subscriptions.

AEW: Fight Forever is an arcade wrestling game featuring AEW talent such as Jon Moxley and Toni Storm. There are multiple match types to play in, including four-way and tag-team, as well as other customizations options. It's a great game for AEW fans as it also has a career mode with over 40 weapons to choose from.

Test Drive Unlimited Solar Crown is the latest entry in the series and features a 1:1 recreation of Hong Kong Island as its main backdrop. If you're looking for an alternative to Forza or The Crew, be sure to check out Test Drive Unlimited Solar Crown.

Finally, Born of Bread is free for all Xbox players until March 9 at 11:59 PM PT / 2:59 AM ET, meaning that you don't need a Game Pass subscription. This game is a turn-based RPG that follows a flour golem named Loaf as he explores the world with his friends.

item.title: Everything We Know About InZoi, Krafton's Upcoming Life Simulator
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/inzoi-release-date-trailer-story/1100-6529953/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After loads of rumors, delays, and brief glimpses of the game, the Korean-made life simulator known as InZoi is almost here. This detailed (and visually stunning) life-sim has fans of the genre--especially weary players of the struggling Sims franchise--very excited for its upcoming release.

But what exactly is InZoi? What does its gameplay consist of? Most importantly, when is it coming out? Curious life-sim fans need not worry--we've got all the answers. Keep reading for a deep dive into everything we currently know about InZOI.

When does InZoi launch?

InZoi is set to release in early access on March 28, 2025, a date confirmed by InZoi director Hyungjun "Kjun" Kim during a discussion on the official InZoi Discord server. This is March 27 in the US.

InZoi was originally slated for release in late 2024, but developer InZoi Studio and publisher Krafton chose to delay the game in order to make sure it's as polished as possible at launch.

InZoi is currently only slated for released on PC for March 27; it's also coming to PS5 and Xbox Series X|S, but there is no release date yet for those platforms.

What platforms is InZoi launching on?

Initially, InZoi will be launching only on PC, but the game's roadmap says Krafton plans to bring the game to PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S at a later date.

Preorder info

Currently, Krafton hasn't shared any information about preordering the game. It is, however, currently available to wishlist on Steam.

What engine was InZoi built on?

InZoi runs on Unreal Engine 5, resulting in stunning visuals, and characters--referred to in-game as Zois--who look realistic rather than cartoonish.

Gamescom 2024 hands-on preview

How does InZoi compare to The Sims 4?

While many players are naturally inclined to compare InZoi to The Sims, Kim has emphasized that InZoi isn't out to steal The Sims' thunder.

"We see InZoi not as a competitor to The Sims, but rather as another option that fans of this genre can enjoy," Kim said in February. "We have great respect for the legacy The Sims has built over the years, since we know that reaching that much depth in such a short period of time is no easy task. This is due to the nature of life-sim games which cover the vast and complex concept of 'life,' making it difficult to capture its every aspect."

What gameplay features does InZoi include?

Although Kim and the InZoi team say they aren't trying to compete with The Sims 4, even a passing glance at the game reveals that features-wise, InZOI appears to be beating The Sims at its own game. InZoi will launch with many of the features The Sims 4 was missing at launch, plus some extras. Currently, we know InZoi will launch with the following features:

  • An extremely detailed and highly customizable character creator known as the Character Studio
  • Detailed clothing and accessory customization
  • A portal players can use to upload their creations, and download other players' creations
  • Personality traits and life aspirations
  • A mode that allows players to build and edit their Zois' homes
  • Cars that Zois can drive (and crash!)
  • Cats (and several other animals, as seen in the character creator and trailers)
  • A city-builder/city-editor with different biomes and aesthetics
  • Color and texture customization for Zois' clothes, homes, and possessions
  • Careers (ranging from K-Pop idol trainee to firefighter, and everything in-between)
  • Skills (including cooking, music, and social interaction)
  • Weather systems
  • Crime (Zois can chase down criminals while working as police officers--or find themselves on the other end of that chase, should they break the law.)
  • Interesting POIs for Zois to visit, including a theme park with rideable roller coasters
  • A freely roamable city to explore (unlike The Sims 4's lot-locked, loading-screen-heavy exploration mechanic)
  • The afterlife (Zois can become ghosts, go to Zoi-heaven, and even commune with other Zois who have passed away.)

The game likely includes even more features--the ones listed above are just the features we know about. GameSpot took InZoi for a spin during Gamescom 2024, and found the game to be impressive both visually and technically.

Does InZoi use generative AI?

Yes. Krafton and InZoi Studio have revealed that generative AI will be used in InZoi. Specifically, players will have the option of making use of an AI system that turns text prompts into in-game items like clothing, wall, and floor patterns. The game also includes a 3D printer-like feature that will allow players to upload photos of real-life objects and turn them into 3D assets to decorate and use in-game.

What are InZoi's PC requirements?

InZoi's minimum PC specs and recommended PC specs are both listed below.

Minimum requirements:

  • OS: Windows 10/11
  • Processor: Intel i5 10400, AMD Ryzen 3600
  • Memory: 12 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA RTX 2060 (8G VRAM), AMD Radeon RX 5600 XT
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 60 GB available space
  • Notes: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system.

Recommended specs:

  • OS: Windows 10/11
  • Processor: Intel i7 12700, AMD Ryzen 5800
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA RTX 3070 (8G VRAM), AMD Radeon RX 6800 XT
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 75 GB available space
  • Notes: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system.

Stay tuned to GameSpot for InZoi-related news as its launch date approaches.
